intro: Adinandra hypochlora, commonly known as the white-leafed adinandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers and leathery, elliptical leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories, thriving in humid environments. Adinandra hypochlora is often found in association with other understory plants, contributing to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
